sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Connection Management:**
- [ ] Client establishes WebSocket connection on login
- [ ] Connection survives network hiccups (auto-reconnect)
- [ ] Heartbeat ping/pong every 30 seconds
- [ ] Graceful fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable

**Notification Types:**
- [ ] New message received
- [ ] Task assignment
- [ ] Status change on watched items
- [ ] System announcements
- [ ] Collaboration updates (user joined, user typing)

**Performance:**
- [ ] Support 10,000 concurrent connections per server
- [ ] Message delivery latency < 100ms
- [ ] CPU usage < 20% at max capacity
sections.business_value:
- Eliminates need for page refreshing
- Improves user engagement and responsiveness
- Reduces server load from polling
- Enables collaborative features
sections.description: Implement real-time push notifications using WebSocket connections to provide instant updates to users.
sections.preconditions:
- WebSocket infrastructure must be available (Socket.io or similar)
- Redis pub/sub for message distribution across servers
- Load balancer must support WebSocket connections
- Client library for WebSocket management

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Supported Formats:**
- [ ] CSV - comma-separated values
- [ ] XLSX - Excel workbook with formatting
- [ ] JSON - structured data export
- [ ] PDF - formatted report with branding

**Export Options:**
- [ ] Select fields to include/exclude
- [ ] Date range filter
- [ ] Sort order selection
- [ ] Page orientation for PDF (portrait/landscape)

**Implementation:**
- [ ] Export button in list views
- [ ] Format selection dropdown
- [ ] Background job for large exports
- [ ] Email notification when export ready
- [ ] Download link expires after 24 hours
sections.business_value: Users need data in different formats for reporting, analysis, and integration with other tools.
sections.description: Enable users to export data in multiple formats: CSV, Excel, JSON, and PDF.
sections.preconditions:
| Format | Library | Version |
|--------|---------|--------|
| CSV | csv | stdlib |
| Excel | openpyxl | 3.1.0 |
| JSON | json | stdlib |
| PDF | reportlab | 4.0.0 |
sections.user_guide:
1. Navigate to any list view (users, reports, etc.)
2. Click "Export" button in toolbar
3. Select desired format from dropdown
4. Configure export options (optional)
5. Click "Generate Export"
6. For small exports: Download starts immediately
7. For large exports: Email sent when ready

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Scheduling Options:**
- [ ] Daily, weekly, monthly schedules
- [ ] Custom cron expressions for advanced users
- [ ] Timezone selection
- [ ] Start date and optional end date

**Delivery Methods:**
- [ ] Email with PDF attachment
- [ ] Email with download link
- [ ] Save to cloud storage (S3, GCS)
- [ ] Webhook notification

**Report Types:**
- [ ] User activity summary
- [ ] Performance metrics
- [ ] Compliance audit report
- [ ] Custom report builder
sections.business_value: Saves time and ensures stakeholders receive regular updates without manual intervention.
sections.description: Allow users to schedule automatic report generation and delivery.
sections.preconditions:
- Celery or similar job scheduler configured
- Email delivery system operational
- Report templates defined
- Cloud storage for report archives
sections.user_guide:
**Creating a Scheduled Report:**
1. Go to Reports → Scheduled Reports
2. Click "New Schedule"
3. Select report type and parameters
4. Choose frequency (daily/weekly/monthly)
5. Add email recipients
6. Click "Create Schedule"

**Managing Schedules:**
- View all schedules in dashboard
- Pause/resume schedules
- Edit schedule parameters
- View execution history
- Download previous reports

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**File Upload:**
- [ ] Drag-and-drop file upload
- [ ] Support CSV and XLSX formats
- [ ] Max file size: 10MB
- [ ] Sample templates available for download

**Validation:**
- [ ] Column header mapping (automatic + manual)
- [ ] Data type validation
- [ ] Required field checking
- [ ] Duplicate detection
- [ ] Preview before import (first 10 rows)

**Processing:**
- [ ] Background processing for large files
- [ ] Progress bar with percentage complete
- [ ] Partial import on errors (continue processing valid rows)
- [ ] Detailed error report for failed rows
- [ ] Transaction rollback option

**Error Handling:**
- [ ] Download error report as CSV
- [ ] Highlight problematic rows and columns
- [ ] Suggested fixes for common errors
- [ ] Ability to fix and re-upload
sections.business_value: Accelerates data migration and initial setup. Reduces manual data entry errors and saves hours of work.
sections.description:
Enable bulk import of data from CSV and Excel files with validation and error handling.

**Supported Entities:**
- Users (bulk user provisioning)
- Products (inventory updates)
- Transactions (bulk data entry)
- Configuration settings
sections.user_guide:
**Import Process:**
1. Click "Import" button
2. Select entity type (Users, Products, etc.)
3. Download template file (optional)
4. Upload your populated CSV/Excel file
5. Map columns if automatic mapping fails
6. Review preview of first 10 rows
7. Click "Import" to process
8. Monitor progress bar
9. Review completion summary
10. Download error report if needed

**Template Format:**
Download templates include:
- Required column headers
- Example data rows
- Data type comments
- Validation rules

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Search Features:**
- [ ] Full-text search across all text fields
- [ ] Fuzzy matching (handle typos)
- [ ] Phrase matching with quotes
- [ ] Boolean operators (AND, OR, NOT)
- [ ] Wildcard search (* and ?)
- [ ] Field-specific search (title:"example")
- [ ] Relevance-based ranking
- [ ] Search suggestions (autocomplete)

**Performance:**
- [ ] Search response time < 200ms (p95)
- [ ] Support 100 concurrent searches
- [ ] Index size < 5GB

**Indexing:**
- [ ] Index users, documents, messages, products
- [ ] Custom analyzers for each language
- [ ] Configurable field weights for ranking
sections.business_value:
- Current search is slow on large datasets (3+ seconds)
- No support for fuzzy matching or typo tolerance
- Cannot search across multiple fields efficiently
- No relevance ranking
sections.description: Replace basic SQL LIKE queries with Elasticsearch for powerful full-text search capabilities.
sections.preconditions:
**Infrastructure:**
- Elasticsearch 8.x cluster (3 nodes)
- Kibana for monitoring and debugging
- Logstash for data synchronization
- 100GB storage allocation

**Data Synchronization:**
- Full index rebuild: Weekly (Sunday 2 AM)
- Incremental updates: Real-time via change data capture
- Fallback: Hourly delta sync job
sections.user_guide:
**Basic Search:**
- Enter search terms in global search box
- Press Enter or click search icon
- Results appear with highlighting

**Advanced Search:**
- Use quotes for exact phrases: "product manager"
- Combine terms: python AND django
- Exclude terms: java NOT javascript  
- Field search: author:"john doe"
- Wildcard: test*

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Tracked Metrics:**
- Search queries (text, filters, results count)
- Click-through rate (which results users clicked)
- Zero-result searches (queries with no results)
- Search refinements (query modifications)
- Time to click (search duration)
- Abandoned searches

**Analytics Dashboard:**
- [ ] Top 100 search queries
- [ ] Most clicked results
- [ ] Zero-result query report
- [ ] Search success rate
- [ ] Average results per query
- [ ] Search trends over time

**Actionable Insights:**
- [ ] Recommend synonyms for common searches
- [ ] Identify content gaps (frequent zero-result queries)
- [ ] Suggest popular content for homepage
- [ ] Alert on broken links in search results
sections.business_value: Insights from search data help improve content organization, identify gaps, and optimize search algorithms.
sections.description: Track and analyze search behavior to improve search relevance and understand user needs.

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Cache Layers:**

1. **Page Cache** (TTL: 5 minutes)
   - Full HTML responses for public pages
   - Vary by user role for personalized pages
   
2. **API Response Cache** (TTL: 2 minutes)
   - GET endpoints only
   - Cache key includes query parameters
   - Skip for user-specific data
   
3. **Database Query Cache** (TTL: 10 minutes)
   - Expensive queries (joins, aggregations)
   - Reference data (countries, categories)
   
4. **Session Cache** (TTL: 8 hours)
   - User sessions and authentication tokens
   - Shopping cart data

**Cache Invalidation:**
- [ ] Automatic invalidation on data updates
- [ ] Manual cache clear for administrators
- [ ] Tag-based invalidation (e.g., clear all user-related caches)
- [ ] LRU eviction when memory limit reached

**Monitoring:**
- [ ] Cache hit/miss rate metrics
- [ ] Memory usage dashboard
- [ ] Slow cache operations alerts
sections.business_value:
- 70% reduction in database load
- 5x faster page load times for cached content
- Better scalability and reduced infrastructure costs
sections.description: Implement comprehensive caching strategy using Redis to improve application performance.
sections.preconditions:
- Redis cluster deployed (3 nodes, master-replica setup)
- Cache warming strategy defined
- Cache invalidation events identified

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Validation Rules:**

Email fields:
- [ ] Valid email format
- [ ] Domain whitelist (optional)
- [ ] Max length: 254 characters

Text inputs:
- [ ] HTML tag stripping or escaping
- [ ] Max length enforcement
- [ ] No control characters
- [ ] Unicode normalization

Numeric inputs:
- [ ] Type validation (int vs float)
- [ ] Range checking (min/max)
- [ ] Precision limits

File uploads:
- [ ] File extension whitelist
- [ ] MIME type verification
- [ ] File size limits
- [ ] Malware scanning

**Error Messages:**
- [ ] User-friendly messages (not technical)
- [ ] Field-specific errors
- [ ] Multiple errors displayed together
- [ ] No sensitive information in errors
sections.business_value: Security best practice. Prevents SQL injection, XSS, command injection, and ensures data integrity.
sections.description: Implement comprehensive server-side input validation to prevent injection attacks and data corruption.
sections.preconditions:
Validation library setup:
- Backend: Pydantic for Python, Joi for Node.js
- Sanitization: bleach for HTML, validator.js for strings
- Content Security Policy headers
sections.user_guide:
When validation fails:
- Red border appears around invalid field
- Error message appears below field
- Submit button remains disabled
- Fix all errors to enable submission

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Consent Management:**
- [ ] Cookie consent banner on first visit
- [ ] Granular consent options (necessary, functional, marketing)
- [ ] Easy withdrawal of consent
- [ ] Consent records stored with timestamp
- [ ] Opt-out links in all marketing emails

**Data Subject Rights:**

1. **Right to Access**
   - [ ] User can download all personal data (JSON format)
   - [ ] Data export includes: profile, activity logs, communications
   - [ ] Export generated within 24 hours
   
2. **Right to Rectification**  
   - [ ] User can edit profile information
   - [ ] Request form for data corrections
   
3. **Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)**
   - [ ] Account deletion request form
   - [ ] 30-day grace period before permanent deletion
   - [ ] Anonymize user data instead of deletion (where legally required to retain)
   - [ ] Email confirmation of deletion
   
4. **Right to Data Portability**
   - [ ] Export data in machine-readable format (JSON/CSV)
   - [ ] Transfer data directly to another service (if possible)

**Privacy by Design:**
- [ ] Data minimization (collect only necessary data)
- [ ] Pseudonymization of personal data in logs
- [ ] Encryption at rest and in transit
- [ ] Access controls and audit logging
- [ ] Automated data retention policies
sections.business_value: Legal requirement for EU users. Builds trust and demonstrates commitment to privacy. Avoids hefty fines (up to 4% of revenue).
sections.connections:
- Related to #112 (audit logging)
- Related to legal compliance initiative
sections.description: Implement features required for GDPR compliance including consent management, data portability, and right to be forgotten.
sections.preconditions:
- Legal review of privacy policy
- Data processing agreements with third parties
- Data classification and inventory complete
- Privacy impact assessment approved
sections.user_guide:
**Accessing Your Data:**
1. Go to Settings → Privacy
2. Click "Download My Data"
3. Email sent when export ready (usually < 1 hour)
4. Download link valid for 48 hours

**Deleting Your Account:**
1. Go to Settings → Privacy
2. Click "Delete My Account"
3. Enter password to confirm
4. Account enters 30-day deletion queue
5. Cancel deletion anytime within 30 days
6. After 30 days, deletion is permanent

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Supported Languages (Phase 1):**
- [ ] English (default)
- [ ] Spanish
- [ ] French
- [ ] German
- [ ] Japanese

**Implementation:**
- [ ] Extract all UI strings to translation files
- [ ] Use i18n library (react-i18next, Flask-Babel, etc.)
- [ ] Language selector in header
- [ ] User language preference saved
- [ ] Browser language auto-detection
- [ ] Fallback to English for missing translations

**Content Types:**
- [ ] UI labels and buttons
- [ ] Error messages
- [ ] Email templates
- [ ] Help documentation
- [ ] Date/time formatting per locale
- [ ] Number formatting (decimals, thousands separators)
- [ ] Currency formatting

**Quality:**
- [ ] 100% translation coverage for supported languages
- [ ] Professional translation review
- [ ] Test all workflows in each language
- [ ] No hardcoded strings in code
sections.business_value: Expands market reach. Improves user experience for non-English speakers. Requirement for international expansion.
sections.description: Add internationalization support to enable multi-language user interface.
sections.preconditions:
- Translation management system (e.g., Crowdin, Lokalise)
- Professional translation service engaged
- Language selection UI/UX designed
- Right-to-left (RTL) layout considerations
sections.user_guide:
**Changing Language:**
1. Click language selector in header (globe icon)
2. Select desired language from dropdown
3. Page refreshes with new language
4. Preference saved for future visits

**For Developers:**
```javascript
// Before
<button>Submit</button>

// After  
<button>{t('common.submit')}</button>
```

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Layout:**
- [ ] Entire UI mirrors for RTL languages
- [ ] Sidebar moves to right side
- [ ] Text alignment: right for RTL, left for LTR
- [ ] Directional icons flipped (arrows, chevrons)
- [ ] Margins and padding reversed

**Text Direction:**
- [ ] HTML dir attribute set correctly (rtl/ltr)
- [ ] Bidirectional text handled correctly (mixed RTL/LTR)
- [ ] Form inputs right-aligned for RTL

**Testing:**
- [ ] Test with Arabic language
- [ ] Test with Hebrew language
- [ ] Test mixed content (English + RTL)
- [ ] Verify all pages render correctly
sections.business_value: Enables product usage in Middle East and Israel markets. Shows cultural sensitivity and attention to detail.
sections.description: Add support for right-to-left languages (Arabic, Hebrew) including layout mirroring and text direction.
sections.preconditions:
- RTL CSS framework or utility classes
- Bi-directional text handling
- Icon flipping for directional icons

sections.acceptance_criteria:
**Flag Types:**
- [ ] Boolean flags (on/off)
- [ ] Percentage rollouts (10%, 25%, 50%, etc.)
- [ ] User segment targeting (beta users, premium, etc.)
- [ ] A/B test variants (variant A vs B vs C)

**Flag Management:**
- [ ] Create/edit/delete flags via admin UI
- [ ] Flag overrides for testing (per-user, per-session)
- [ ] Flag change history and audit log
- [ ] Schedule flag changes (enable at specific time)

**Integration:**
- [ ] Backend flag evaluation
- [ ] Frontend flag evaluation
- [ ] Real-time flag updates (no deployment needed)
- [ ] Default values when flag service unavailable

**Examples:**
```python
if feature_flags.is_enabled('new_dashboard', user):
    return render_new_dashboard()
else:
    return render_old_dashboard()
```
sections.business_value:
Enables:
- Safe deployment of new features
- Gradual rollout to subset of users
- Quick rollback without code deployment
- A/B testing for feature validation
- Different features for different user segments
sections.description: Implement feature flags system for gradual rollouts and A/B testing.
sections.preconditions:
- Feature flag service (LaunchDarkly, Unleash, or custom)
- Admin UI for flag management
- SDK integration in application code

sections.description:
Test case with markdown table:

| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 |
|----------|----------|----------|
| Value A  | Value B  | Value C  |
| Value D  | Value E  | Value F  |

This tests table preservation in normalization.

sections.acceptance_criteria:
1. First criterion
2. Second criterion  
   - Nested item A
   - Nested item B
3. Third criterion
sections.description:
Test complex markdown:

```python
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
    return 42
```
sections.user_guide:
- **Bold item**: description
- *Italic item*: description
- `Code item`: description

user_stories.title: Issue with code blocks and lists
